Detailed Description

Array of Image in a FITS file.

Inherites from FitsImage

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FitsImageArray::FitsImageArray ( const string & FileName,
const FitsFileMode Mode = RO )
 

Constructor for an existing fits image.

  • Opens in (ReadOnly (RO) mode by default, use RW to modify or create)
  • In RW mode, use this creator for an image already containing several images, i.e. with EXTEND=true (if EXTEND=false, IsValid()=false)

FitsImageArray::FitsImageArray ( const string & FileName,
const FitsHeader & header,
bool ImageInFirstHDU = true )
 

Constructor for a new FitsImageArray with a minimal header from an existing FitsHeader.

This header is used as a reference for image size, filter, chip. A criterion for accepting images can be set with the function SetCriterion using the values of the enum FitsImageArray::Criterion. For instance SetCriterion(FitsImageArray::FILTER|FitsImageArray::CHIP) <=> ask for the same filter and chip.

Parameters:
ImageInFirstHDU, if   true (default) the first image that is added is saved in the first HDU, otherwise it is saved in the second one.

FitsImageArray::FitsImageArray ( const string & FileName,
const Image & image,
bool ImageInFirstHDU = true )
 

Constructor for a new FitsImageArray with a minimal header from an existing Image.

This Image is used as a reference for image size (see previous constructor). The user can define other keys for accepting other images.

Parameters:
ImageInFirstHDU, if   true (default) the first image that is added is saved in the first HDU, otherwise it is saved in the second one.

Member Function Documentation

Status FitsImageArray::Append ( const Image & image )
 

Add an Image after the latest HDU.

Parameters:
Image   that is appended.
  • A default FitsHeader is written, namely with NAXIS*, BSCALE, BZERO, BITPIX=16, and WRITEDAT
  • The user may add information to the header after the call to this function

Status FitsImageArray::Append ( const string & filename )
 

Add a FitsImage after the latest HDU.

Parameters:
filename, name   of the fits file to append Uses cfitsio fits_copy_hdu, i.e. toads is not used a lot except for checking the compatibility of FitsHeader

bool FitsImageArray::CheckHeader ( FitsHeader & header )
 

Check whether header is consistent with fMainHeader.

  • Used by FitsImageArray::Append
  • Uses fSelectedCriterion (see SetCriterion)

void FitsImageArray::SetCriterion ( int value ) [inline]
 

Set the criterion for merging of FitsImage.

Parameters:
value   : example FitsImageArray::CHIP|FitsImageArray::FILTER
